Posts.Content: So sorry to hear of your mum's battle Asma. I too had taxol for awhile and it was a rather rough chemo. I wish I could tell you I am very knowledgeable about the best cancer centers, but I chose to go to one in the state I live which is Washington. It has been a good experience for me at Cancer Center Northwest in Spokane, however, I chose it because it was only a 2 hour commute from home. I pray, your mum has been able to endure her rough treatment and is improving. Sending positive thoughts your way.  Sandie
Posts.Title: Stage IV breast cancer spread to liver and bones

Posts.Title: Stage IV breast cancer spread to liver and bones

Posts.Content: Hello Suzanne,   I too was diagnosed with breast cancer with mets to liver and bone a couple years ago. I had a mastectomy last year and have been on a variety of chemos over the last 2 years. Like you I get a monthly infusion of Zometa. I was intrigued to read about the Essiac Tea you take and plan on getting some. Thanks for sharing. As for working, I am the director of Nutrition Services at our local hospital and can't imagine not working. It truly keeps my mind busy and I am glad for being surrounded and supported by my wonderful caring staff and so many others in the hospital. I feel that by serving and helping others, it can alleviate many of our own personal fears. I hope this may help in some way.  Thanks, Sandie

Posts.Title: Stage IV breast cancer spread to liver and bones

Posts.Content: I am glad to hear you are doing well with Afinitor. I was on it for about 3 months and I had the worst joint pains. When I got my scan, my cancer had grown and spread. I pray you have a much better experience. I look forward to hearing good results for you. Sandie
Posts.Title: New med AFINTOR

Posts.Content: Hello,   I was diagnosed with breast cancer with mets to the bone and liver. After having a mastectomy and going through 2 years of chemo, the cancer has settled in my liver. I am scheduled for chemoembolization next week and I am wondering if anyone has any personal experiences to share regarding this treatment. Thanks, Sandie
Posts.Title: chemoembolization
